result.execSummary:
The defendant Charlie Smith Jr. was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Charlie Smith Jr. is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Charlie Smith Jr. was found guilty of Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

3:17 p.m. Defendant Charlie  Smith in court. Calling 9 cases.  Defendant states he is employed with Fosters and Smith and made payment today. Court approves $200 payment plan and will include all cases in payment plan. Court cautions defendant to not miss payment. Adj. 3:18 p.m.

3:29 p.m. Defendant Charlie  Smith in court.  Defendant states he has been making payments. Owes on several cases. Court authorizes $100 payment every month beginning April 1, 2017 for all fines owed. Adj. 3:30 p.m.  Review hearing scheduled for August 7, 2017 at 03:00 pm.
from defendant to Judge

3:38 p.m. Defendant Charlie  Smith in court with attorney Daniel Francis Snyder.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Schiek states agreement. State moves to dismiss Count 1 and 3 - Granted. Plea questionnaire filed. Defendant pleads no contest.   Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that a factual basis for the plea exists and finds defendant guilty.  Snyder requests this case to be added to payment plan with Clerk of Court and increase monthly payment to $100.00. Schiek/Snyder/Court statement on sentencing.
Court Sentence
Fine - $579.00 including costs
Special disposition under 973.015 if defendant pays fine in full by February 20, 2017 at 3:300 p.m. 
Payment plan in original payment plan to remain at $50.00 per month. Payment plan in this matter to be $100 per month. 
Appeal rights given. Payment plan application given. 
Adj. 3:49 p.m.  Review hearing scheduled for February 20, 2017 at 03:00 pm.

10:48 a.m. Defendant Charlie  Smith in court with attorney Daniel Francis Snyder.  Mary Margaret Sowinski appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Sowinski/Snyder statement to resolution - request date for plea/sentencing. Bail continued. Adj. 10:49 a.m.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 9, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

discovery demand, motion to suppress, extension of time to filing pre-trial motions & certificate of service - includes cover letter
